name: NSIndexPath
desc: An object containing a list of indexes that bridges to IndexPath; use NSIndexPath when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

items.name: init(index: Int)
items.desc: Initializes an index path with a single node.

items.name: init(indexes: UnsafePointer<Int>?, length: Int)
items.desc: Initializes an index path with the given nodes and length.

items.name: init(row: Int, section: Int)
items.desc: Initializes an index path with the indexes of a specific row and section in a table view.

items.name: init(item: Int, section: Int)
items.desc: Initializes an index path with the indexes of a specific item and section in a collection view.

items.name: var section: Int
items.desc: An index number identifying a section in a table view or collection view.

items.name: var row: Int
items.desc: An index number identifying a row in a section of a table view.

items.name: var item: Int
items.desc: An index number identifying an item in a section of a collection view.

items.name: var length: Int
items.desc: The number of nodes in the index path.

items.name: func adding(Int) -> IndexPath
items.desc: Returns an index path containing the nodes in the receiving index path plus another given index.

items.name: func removingLastIndex() -> IndexPath
items.desc: Returns an index path with the nodes in the receiving index path, excluding the last one.

items.name: func compare(IndexPath) -> ComparisonResult
items.desc: Indicates the depth-first traversal order of the receiving index path and another index path.

items.name: func index(atPosition: Int) -> Int
items.desc: Provides the value at a particular node in the index path.

items.name: func getIndexes(UnsafeMutablePointer<Int>, range: NSRange)
items.desc: Copies the indexes stored in the index path from the positions specified by the position range into the specified indexes.
